unit: Unit 7 | Inference for Quantitative Data: Means
title: Tennis Anyone?
question_text:
A company was hired to compare the bounce height of two brands of tennis balls using a $90\%$ confidence interval. A bounce method was established and $15$ balls were randomly selected and tested from each brand. Brand $1$ had a mean bounce height of $5.8$ feet and a standard deviation of $1.1$ feet. Brand $2$ had a bounce height of $5.3$ feet and a standard deviation of $0.9$ feet.
Assuming that all conditions were met and that a $d.f. = 14$ would be used, find the margin of error of this confidence interval.
